headline.main: NBC to Donald Trump: You're Fired
headline.print_headline: NBC to Donald Trump: You're Fired

docs.snippet: NBC said Monday that it is ending its business relationship with mogul and GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump because of comments he made about Mexican immigrants during the announcement of his campaign....
docs.lead_paragraph: NBC said Monday that it is ending its business relationship with mogul and GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump because of comments he made about Mexican immigrants during the announcement of his campaign.

headline.main: Obama Signs Trade, Worker Assistance Bills Into Law
headline.print_headline: Obama Signs Trade, Worker Assistance Bills Into Law

docs.snippet: In a rare bipartisan scene at the White House, President Barack Obama on Monday signed into law two hard-fought bills giving him greater authority to negotiate international trade deals and providing aid to workers whose jobs are displaced by such...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a rare bipartisan scene at the White House, President Barack Obama on Monday signed into law two hard-fought bills giving him greater authority to negotiate international trade deals and providing aid to workers whose jobs are displaced by such pacts.

headline.main: De La Hoya Says Has Decided Against Making a Comeback

docs.lead_paragraph: Boxing Hall of Famer and former Olympic champion Oscar De La Hoya, after pondering a return to the ring, said on Monday that he would remain retired.

headline.main: Haiti's Image Explored in Photo Exhibit at Florida Museum
headline.print_headline: Haiti's Image Explored in Photo Exhibit at Florida Museum

docs.snippet: When photography was new, wealthy Haitians posed for the camera in fine clothes and formal parlors, as at home in the world's capitals as any of their European or American peers....

headline.main: Conflicts Rob 30 Million Children of Education: Norwegian PM
headline.print_headline: Conflicts Rob 30 Million Children of Education: Norwegian PM

docs.snippet: Armed conflicts deprive about 30 million children of education worldwide and governments need to step up investments to make schools safer, partly by widening use of the Internet, Norway's Prime Minister Erna Solberg said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Armed conflicts deprive about 30 million children of education worldwide and governments need to step up investments to make schools safer, partly by widening use of the Internet, Norway's Prime Minister Erna Solberg said on Monday.

headline.main: 1917 | A Rebel Flag on Subway Walls?

headline.main: Afghanistan and U.N. Agency Agree on Police Funding Plan
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan and U.N. Agency Agree on Police Funding Plan

docs.snippet: Afghanistan and the United Nations have reached agreement to transfer to Kabul's control a controversial multi-billion dollar fund intended to rebuild the police force and pay officers, the U.N. Development Programme (UNDP) said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Afghanistan and the United Nations have reached agreement to transfer to Kabul's control a controversial multi-billion dollar fund intended to rebuild the police force and pay officers, the U.N. Development Programme (UNDP) said on Monday.
